results.title: The 12 steps: recovering from addictions. - Steps One to Eight.
results.creator_credit: Jim Hanley, Kaleidoscope Entertainment, Manitoba TV and Sleeping Giant Productions
results.brief_description: Throughout the 13 episodes, 12 characters are constantly entwined. Their experiences of the Alcoholics Anonymous 12 step program, compellingly told and captured first hand are interspersed with expert opinion for structural cohesiveness and direction. Step 1: “We admitted we were powerless over our addiction - that our lives had become unmanageable.” 2. “Came to believe that a Power greater than ourselves could restore us to sanity”. 3. “Made a decision to turn our will and our lives over to the care of God as we understood him.”. 4. “Made a searching and fearless moral inventory of ourselves.” 5. “Admitted to ourselves and to another human being the exact nature of our wrongs.” 6. “Were entirely ready to have God remove all these defects of character.” 7. “Humbly asked him to remove our shortcomings.” 8. “Made a list of all persons we had harmed and became willing to make amends to them all.” Narrated by John Vernon.

results.title: The Adventures of Pinocchio
results.creator_credit: Steve Barron, Jeffrey Sneller, Raju Patel, Allied Pinocchio Prod, Davis Film and Video Production and Dieter Gessler Filmproduktions
results.brief_description: This classic Italian story about Gepetto the carpenter who makes a wooden boy which he can love as a son. This production has wonderful computer animated special effects as the wooden “boy” becomes flesh. For those who loved the award winning Disney production, this version of the age-old story will delight all the family. Starring Martin Landau and Jonathan Taylor Thomas.

results.title: That's entertainment
results.brief_description: For over 50 years MGM produced an array of dazzling stars and musical spectaculars. “That’s Entertainment” is a compilation of snippets and sequences from nearly 100 musicals, featuring great moments with most of the studio’s major singing and dancing stars, including Judy Garland, Fred Astaire, Eleanor Powell, Gene Kelly and many more.

results.title: The Adventures of Blinky Bill
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: Blinky Bill is one of the most loved characters in Australian children’s literature. He and his friends get up to many adventures in the bush in this popular animated series.

group_works.title: Detective Blinky; Blink Bill's wedding picnic.
group_works.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films

results.title: Detective Blinky; Blink Bill's wedding picnic.
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Adventures of Blinky Bill”.
Two adventures with Australia’s most lovable Koala. “Detective Blinky”: Someone is stealing the berries from the town’s only Mulgaberry bush. Detective Blinky is on the case with Splodge to catch the culprit. “Blinky Bill’s wedding picnic”: Blinky’s mother and Nutsy’s father are getting married and a big celebration is planned. At the wedding picnic, everyone has a good time and the Dingos finally learn to live in harmony with everyone.

results.title: The Adventures of Milo and Otis (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Masanori Hata, Masaru Kakutani, Satoru Ogata, Columbia Pictures and Fuji Television Network
results.brief_description: Join a curious kitten named Milo and his inseparable buddy, a pug-nosed pup named Otis, as they fall, frolic, glide and tumble through one exciting escapade after another. Narrated by Dudley Moore. Based on an original story by Masanori Hata.

results.title: Terminator 2: judgement day
results.creator_credit: James Cameron, Lightstorm Entertainment and Pacific Western
results.brief_description: Sequel to “Terminator”. The story resumes several years later in present day Los Angeles. A cybernetic assassin and bodyguard are sent back from the future. This time the target is John Connor (Edward Furlong), Sarah’s son. The story revolves around the conflict between two Terminators over the the boy’s life and ultimately the future of the human race. Arnold Schwarzenegger and Robert Patrick are suitably impressive and menacing as the two cyborgs, but in the words of James Cameron, the “real” terminator is Linda Hamilton as Sarah Connor. Her transformation from desperate prey, in the original film, to vigilante guerilla is rivetting. At the time of its release, “Terminator 2: Judgement Day” was the most expensive film ever made at a cost of $100 million. Fans of action adventure, mind-boggling special effects and wanton destruction will not be disappointed.

constellations_other.name: Gooey goo goo
constellations_other.description: The special effects used in Symbiosis are curiously similar to some sticky Oscar-winning movies.
